trans-unit.source: Displays links to table actions such as edit, delete, and insert.
In this topic:
[Introduction](#introduction)
[Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax)
Introduction
The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicHyperLink> control creates links that are based on the table actions that are enabled by Dynamic Data.
These actions are defined in the Global.asax file as default routing rules.
The rules are associated with default page templates such as Edit.aspx, List.aspx, and so on.
When the user clicks the link, a page is displayed that enables the user to perform the action that is specified by the link.
The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicHyperLink> control enables you to create the following links:
Table row data-bound links, which are for data-item specific action links such as "Edit" and "Details".
Dynamic Data infers the table and the primary key from the current row.
An example of these links is in the Edit.aspx page of a Dynamic Data Web site.
Links to <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable> objects, which are specific action links such as "List" and "Insert" that in turn point to objects such as tables.
An example of these links is in the Default.aspx page of a Dynamic Data Web site.
Unbound links, which create table action links outside a data-bound control.
An example of these links is in the Insert link in the List.aspx page template of a Dynamic Data Web site.
Because these links are not part of a data-bound control that has a defined data context, you must specify the table to access and the action to perform.
If you specify "Edit" or "Details" as the action, you must also provide the primary key.
The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicHyperLink> control supports additional markup attributes then can be forwarded to the routing engine when the link is activated.
This can be useful when you want to have an item-specific link from a non-data-bound context.
Declarative Syntax
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicHyperLink"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the action that is associated with the link.
The predefined values that you can assign to this property are "Edit", "Insert", "List", and "Details".
Each of these values is associated with a page template.
You can also assign custom values.
Custom values must be supported by custom page templates.
The action that is associated with the link.
Gets or sets the data context for the data model that the link applies to.
If the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicHyperLink> control is used in a data-bound control, the default value is the same as the one that is used by the data-bound control.
The data context that applies to the link.
Gets or sets the link display text.
If the link display text is empty, the default display `string` is used.
The link display text.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.DataBinding"></xref> event.
This method notifies a <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicHyperLink> control that it should perform any logic for binding data.
The event data.
An attempt was made to set the table and data context during data binding.
-or-
An attempt has been made to bind to a `null` data field.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender"></xref> event.
This method notifies a <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicHyperLink> control that it should perform any necessary pre-rendering steps before the control saves view state and renders content.
The event data.
The <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicHyperLink"></xref> object cannot determine the data table to link to.
Gets or sets the table for the link action.
The name of the table for the link action.
Retrieves the value of the specified attribute that is applied to the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicHyperLink"></xref> control.
The name of the attribute to retrieve.
The specified attribute that is applied to the link.
Defines an attribute and its value to apply to the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicHyperLink"></xref> control.
The name of the attribute.
The value that is assigned to the attribute.
